articles.description: Glenn Maxwell hits the fastest men's World Cup century in 40 balls as Australia inflict a record tournament defeat on the Netherlands in Delhi.
articles.title: Maxwell hits fastest World Cup ton as Australia win

articles.description: England captain Owen Farrell says the online abuse of team-mate Tom Curry after the flanker reported an alleged on-pitch slur to the referee is "unacceptable".
articles.title: Farrell criticises 'unacceptable' abuse of Curry

articles.description: Mark Cavendish says the route planned for the 2024 Tour de France could be the toughest version of the race he has ever encountered.
articles.title: Cavendish 'shocked' by how hard 2024 Tour route is

articles.description: Charley Hull and Justin Rose will team up together in the Grant Thornton Invitational, a mixed team event being staged by the PGA and LPGA Tours.
articles.title: Hull and Rose to team up in PGA & LPGA Tour mixed event

articles.description: BBC Sport visits Tyneside to explore how Newcastle United have gone from relegation candidates to a Champions League club since being taken over in 2021.
articles.title: 'The whole city is buzzing' - Is Newcastle's rise unstoppable?

articles.description: American heavyweight Deontay Wilder says it would be a "major disaster" if he never gets to fight Anthony Joshua.
articles.title: I'm ready to fight Joshua, says Wilder

articles.description: England's World Cup squad still has the fight needed to turn their campaign around, says all-rounder Moeen Ali.
articles.title: If anyone can turn World Cup around it is us - Moeen
